name: SimpleWhite about:newtab Tiles Fix
description: This gives the option to remove the perspective (oblique/slant appearance) form the tiles in the new tab page when using Louis Chan's Simple White theme (or its variations) in Firefox. It also gives the a choice to display smaller tiles in that page. You can select from a list of progressively smaller tiles sizes with different aspect ratios.
additional_info: The change in tile size may affect other Firefox themes besides Simple White, e.g., the default theme and light themes. However it may or may not affect either of the tile dimensions (width and height) when used with other complete themes for Firefox. In the list of tile sizes the first three choices have the same width but they are progressively shorter in height. The next set of three follows the same progression with a smaller fixed width. The last two are progressively narrower. The first choice is the default for Firefox 40 and later, 290×210 px², setting the default ratio between 3:2, used often in photography, and 4:3, used for full screen movies and an old standard in computers. The second value, Golden Ratio, is practically the default in Firefox 39 and earlier, 290×180 px², (the value used, 290×169 px², is closer to the Golden Ratio = (1+√5)/2 ). The wide 16:9 ratio is the common widescreen aspect. I personally use the smallest size that can fit the standard 15 tiles in a 1024×768 px² window. In the past I often used the small wide 16:9 tiles because they would fit a full screenshot, but only if it was taken when the I used Firefox in full screen mode. The primary screenshot is with Simple White X and the tiles choice is Small / Golden Ratio. The next screenshot is with blue evening scene and the tiles choice is Smallest / Default Ratio. Both were taken in a 1366×786 px² window.
